subclusters.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
DNA Damage Response and Cell Cycle Arrest-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Inflammaging-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
Mitogen Recognition Decline and Cell Cycle Transit Hindrance Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence caused by limited cell divisions and altered transcription factors, linked to telomere-related growth arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening as a biological clock triggering replicative senescence and cell cycle arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights p16INK4a accumulation as a key mediator of replicative senescence linked to cell division limits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes finite replicative lifespan controlled by telomere shortening and gene expression changes enforcing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as a molecular clock limiting cell divisions and triggering senescence as an anticancer mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere erosion in chondrocytes causing replicative senescence and tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Telomere attrition as a hallmark and biomarker of aging linked to cellular senescence and mortality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence as a mitotic clock driven by telomere shortening and tumor suppressor pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores telomere dysfunction and p21 in aging and cancer, linking replicative senescence to tumor suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on finite replicative capacity and accumulation of senescent cells due to telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Combines replicative senescence from telomere shortening with stress-induced premature senescence and SASP in organ aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence limiting cell division and tissue renewal, with SASP contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response and Cell Cycle Arrest-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreversible cell cycle arrest induced by persistent DNA damage and CDK inhibitors p16 and p21 enforcing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response and Cell Cycle Arrest-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence triggered by oncogenic signals, DNA damage, oxidative stress, and telomere dysfunction acting as tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response and Cell Cycle Arrest-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p53 activation by DNA damage and telomere shortening induces senescence and apoptosis, balancing tumor suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP secretion by senescent cells and its dual role in inflammation, tissue repair, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP factors secreted by senescent cells inducing paracrine and autocrine senescence and chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-messaging secretome (SMS) factors triggering premature senescence in neighboring cells via paracrine signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details SASP-driven chronic inflammation, apoptosis resistance, and antagonistic pleiotropy of senescence in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links SASP secretion by senescent cells to prostate disease progression and tissue microenvironment remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent cells and SASP-driven chronic inflammation contributing to autoimmune disease via immune imbalance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Inflammaging-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction in immune cells causing premature senescence, SASP-like inflammation, and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Inflammaging-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links genomic instability-induced senescence in vascular cells with PDE1 dysregulation and vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitogen Recognition Decline and Cell Cycle Transit Hindrance Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging results from progressive decline in mitogen recognition and response, causing senescence distinct from quiescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitogen Recognition Decline and Cell Cycle Transit Hindrance Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progressive hindrance of cell cycle transit and heterogeneous proliferative states leading to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitogen Recognition Decline and Cell Cycle Transit Hindrance Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights intrinsic cellular clocks and loss of mitogen responsiveness causing replicative senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Paracrine Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on antagonistic pleiotropy of senescence and SASP secretion including VEGF promoting tumor progression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nucleolus-Centered Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes nucleolus and rDNA locus as key regulators of cellular senescence and aging via nucleolar integrity and Sir proteins.
